column6: “Good situation, near underground and in a live neighborhood.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• 5-Bed Family Room with Private Bathroom', '• Stayed 4 nights']
column8:
About breakfast, I´m sorry this comment, but during all my travels from 1986 to now, this time is the worst breakfast that I had. I have been in a basic youth hostels, and never there they offert me awful breakfast; even the breakfast´s place was no right.
See below breakfast´s description:
It takes place along the narrow lift´s aisle. No breakfast room.
Upon wooden bar, along half aisle and 30cm depth. Only 5 stools. No tables, no chairs.
Colours plastic glass and dishes. No crystal or transparent plastic glass and dishes. Colours plastic not hygienic.
No water. You have to pay for.
No milk.
Local coffee. No black coffee.
Only sandwich bread. No normal bread.
Peanut jam and butter placed in big plastic box.
Also price increased 3%, to the final price according with booking.com.
column9: Good situation, near underground and in a live neighborhood.

column6: “Price was okay for Singapore, but prefer to pay 5 dollar more to have a better stay!”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
The hostel didn’t meet our backpacker expectations at all. The room was too small for the amount of people in it. No privacy at all. There’s an open door to the bathroom in the room itself. Because of that you can hear everything and you’ll stay awake jn rhe middle of the night if someone’s taking a shower or even goes to the toilet. 
Besides that, there are not only travellers who stay in the hostel, but it seems like some people live in the hostel and make their own rules as well. 
Breakfast is served in a small hallway with families who want to make breakfast with one toaster for everyone, so you have to wait a long time for your free breakfast.
column9: Location is really good and 24/7 reception is nice.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 1 night']

column6: “A convenient hostel with amazing staff and location!”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• 5-Bed Family Room with Private Bathroom', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: Nothing to be honest. We got what we paid for an affordable hostel is Singapore. The place is clean and good. Maybe just include towels at least in the bathrooms even just small ones.
column9: The staff was very accommodating and kind. Their breakfast, though simple, is unlimited toast with coffee and tea. Hot water is always available and the staff is always attentive to your concerns. It is perfect for families just make sure to bring your own toiletries as you know budget hostels don't include them. The rooms are cleaned every single day and the beds are comfortable. The corridors are also clean and the shower has working hot water which is also easy to use. It is definitely worth it for the price plus it's close to many attractions by train!

Checked in from Jun 11-16, 2019. It was a nice and comfortable stay with good value for families in a budget.
Very kind receptionists and staff- bincy and mhykhy. The place is very near Rochor  and Little India MRT station and bus stops. Good place to stay for family. Clean bathrooms. Easy to buy soda and water from the front desk. Walking distance from Bugis and Mustafa. Near Mc Donalds Bugis.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• 6-Bed Family room with Private Bathroom', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Air conditioning spoilt on our last night, hence, it was boiling in your room. We had to keep the windows open that night for better ventilation but the air coming in is also warm as temperature was up to 33C outside. No electric fans provided. Fire safety needs improvement. On one occasion, the fire alarm was triggered for an unknown reason. Staff didn't know how to deactivate it as it was a false alarm. The fire exit was cluttered, making it unsafe to use in case there was a real fire.

column6: “Not recommended for families. Suitable for students and single budget travelers.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• 4-Bed Family Room with Private Bathroom', '• Stayed 4 nights']
column8: When I was a student, this kind of place was totally ok to stay at, but it was quite a challenge with a family. In our room right above my pillow there was a hole in the sealing with all pipes clearly visible. The walls looked like renovation was badly needed. Air con was too cold (it was not possible to set different temperature) to keep it all night long, so we would switch it off before going to sleep. And then the night was too hot. The room was super tiny. Just for beds and that's it. Not even a table and chair. Maybe it is my fault, that I have booked one of the cheapest rooms in Singapore straight away without checking other options. My recommendation is that if you travel with family, pay 20 - 30 eur per night more and get a room in a 3* hotel. I think experience will be much different. This place could be ok if you need just a place to sleep.
column9: The beds even though made sounds every time you turn, were quite comfy. Generally the place was quite clean. Staff was friendly and really helpful. The hostel is very close to MRT. That's about it.

It's annoyed in the evening.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• 7-Bed Family Room with Private Bathroom', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
NO towels provided. They charge S$ for each.
NO Toiletries like soap, toothpaste, shampoo and conditioner provided.
Their Free Breakfast was ONLY SANDWICH (everyday) with similar peanut buttter, butter and strawberry jam. -these are the only options you have. Plus there is a rule that you have to “CLEAN YOUR PLATE FOR THE NEXT GUEST WHO WILL USE” -what the heck was that. They should provide disposable paper cups and paper plates.
There are posting regarding their “house rules” one of which is to bring the linens and blankets to the reception the day of the check out which we did then the reception told us there is no need, so we wasted our time and effort doing that. They should remove this “house rules” posting which do not reallY apply. 
The duvet provided doesn’t have a cover.
Lastly, they will clean your room while you are away and will not ask permission. Good thing we keep our things locked and we are not leaving valuables.
column9:
Location -Its very near the Rochor MRT station 
Quite at night, you can sleep well

column9: Worth for money spent. If u have pleasant room mates.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 6 nights']
column8: I reserved an 8 bed room on an upper floor with windows and a lot of light...when I checked in they ask for full payment for 6 days and I paid them and they sent their man to make up the bed and then they took me to a small main floor with 4 beds at the back of the building next to the laundry room. I told them that is not what my reservation was for and they said it was all they had available...I asked them to refund my money and they said they could not make refunds...I booked another place after three nights and lost the money for the other 3 nites because they refused to refund the money.  NEVER AGAIN WILL I STAY THERE AND WILL MAKE THE COMPLAINT ON THEIR WEB SITE.   Roy Gentry

The hotel besides muslim Restaurant which opens 24 hour. They offer variety of menus, quite affordable price and taste good. Mustafa Center and Bugis Junction is only 10 minutes away on foot. Myky and Bincy are always informartive and helpful. 
We really enjoy our stay in Snooze Inn.

column6: “We came with 4 people in one room, the room and bath room...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• 5-Bed Family Room with Private Bathroom', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column9:
We came with 4 people in one room, the room and bath room was quite clean but very small with 2 bunk beds, if you sleep on the top, the air conditioner flowing to your face.
The breakfast room very small and very crowded, people was cramming to get toast and it not very comfortable, we skip breakfast during our stay.  The location is super, just 3-5 minutes walk to Rochor and Jalan Besar MRT.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: A bedroom which should have 2 bunkbeds max had 4. Little room to step. Bathroom unpleasant and toilet roll was not refilled in 48 hours.
column9: Nothing really

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• 4-Bed Family Room with Private Bathroom', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
There was also a staff who is not really friendly.
The room is quite small, light in room is not bright enough and the toilet is also quite small, the floor made me feel like it was wet.
column9:
I didn't eat breakfast here but I saw that they provide breakfast everyday and it seemed delicious.
There's a staff who is really friendly. I asked her so much about areas, street, how to use transport and she helped me everything. She also lent me an iron too <3 They also cleaned up the room daily.
This place is really near to MRT station (Jalan Besar station, Downtown line) so it was very convenient to go to everywhere.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• 6-Bed Family room with Private Bathroom', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column9: My friends and I stayed for 3D2N in the 6 Beds Family Room with private bathroom. The room is very comfortable and value for the money. The location is great as we get near access to the MRT Station Downtown Line (Rochor) in walking distance within 5 mins! The power went out for awhile but the staffs are quick to handle! Thankyou guys!

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 6-Bed Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']

column8: The receptionist goes with every single guest to unlock the room door every single time...which is time consuming and ineficient  (guests don't receive their keys). Bathroom door is thin and you can hear all the noises amplified. No soap, no shampoo no towels. You can rent towels for 1 $ plus 3$ deposit. Printing is 0.50$ per page (5 times more than other hostels)
column9: Good location. Good staff. Breakfast is toasts butter and coffee or tea. Walking distance to Little India. 30 min walking to Gardens By The Bay. Close to bus and MRT (2 min)

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 8-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']

column9: Location of the hostel is super cool! Great, great staff! So friendly speaking prefect English ready to help with any questions you may have! The breakfast was also very nice - self service, you can get a toast and coffee as for me this is what I need in the morning.
